results.title: Equality and development
results.creator_credit: Mark Robbins, Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made during International Women’s Year, 1975, this film is about an International Women’s Forum discussing equal rights for women. In Tunisia, small changes have begun, but more is needed. Women need more education, and employment opportunities; to eradicate illiteracy and teach family planning. The cities and amusements belong to the men - this is to be changed.

results.title: A Woman's place is...
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
This film was made during the International Women’s Year, 1975 and focuses on Sweden as an example of committed government using the full range of tools at its disposal in a real attempt to give substance to equality for women as set down in the United Nations Charter. Discusses women’s role in the workforce, sexism in the advertising world, men’s role in parenting and sharing house duties, educating primary aged children about gender roles and stereotyping, and basically highlighting the need for equality in all areas of life. Narrated by Joyce Gordon.

results.title: Eskimo artist: Kenojouac
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Beautiful Inuit prints by an artist who is also a wife and mother. This film shows how the Inuit artist’s drawings are transferred to stone and then printed for sale in the south.

results.title: Eskimo winter
results.creator_credit: Richard Robinson, George Pearson, Michael McKennirey, Brian Branston, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People of the Seal”.
The second of two co-productions by the British Broadcasting Corporation and the National Film Board of Canada, People of the Seal, Part 2: Eskimo Winter is compiled from some of the most vivid footage ever filmed of the life of the Netsilik Inuit in the Pelly Bay region of the Canadian Arctic. Together, the two films provide insight and understanding of a culture now almost vanished, as they show the incredible resourcefulness of the Netsilik (People of the Seal) who have adapted to one of the world’s harshest environments. Part 2: Eskimo Winter shows how Inuit families gather in communities on the sea ice to harpoon seal as they come up through breathing holes in the ice. Also seen is the mid-winter season, a time of intense socialising in the communal igloo, with games, contests and ceremonial activities. (Awards: Salerno; Trento) Narrated by Alexander Scourby

results.title: Eric & Ernie's Xmas Show = The Morecambe & Wise Christmas Show
results.brief_description: A selection of comedy sketches by one of Britain’s favourite TV comedy duos, Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise, from their Christmas shows. Guests include Peter Barkworth, Peter Cushing, Hannah Gordon, Glenda Jackson, Mick McManus, Gemma Craven, Jill Gascoine, Sir Alec Guinness, Peter Vaughan.

results.title: Eraserhead
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: Lynch’s debut film has been re-released with a new print and stereo mix soundtrack. Opinion is divided as to film’s brilliance but over the years it has achieved cult status in it’s genre. Shot in black and white with an incredible soundtrack and tight script, ‘Eraserhead’ is the story of a timid printer Henry Spencer (John Nance) who lives in an apartment building trying to figure out what to do with his horribly mutated son. Lynch described the film as ” a dream of dark and troubling things.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute

results.title: Equality. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Art Ciocco, Paul Buck, Ken Stein, New Jersey Public Television and Best Films
results.brief_description: Explores the diversity of people and the breadth of the problems as one searches for “equality”. Concentrates on the basic areas of economics, ethnic groups, problems of old age and alternate lifestyle. Contains some b&w sequences.
